defect.para: On some AmTran RE™ and AmTran FE™ school buses, the anchor seats were assembled without the under floor reinforcement plate on the inboard mounting of the seat to the floor above the fuel tank. Past testing of mounting hardware without the reinforcement plate showed the configuration would not meet the requirements of FMVSS 210. School buses built with seat belts and without the reinforcement are non-compliant to FMVSS 210 and an accident could result in personal injury. School buses, built in the above time frame with the between the frame rail fuel tank option and 39 inch and 45 inch anchor passenger seats (seat belt ready seats), that did not have belts installed by American Transportation are also included in this recall.

The vehicles involved are the AmTran RE™ and AmTran FE™ buses built from November 29, 1999 through May 31, 2000 with the between the frame rail fuel tank option and 39 inch and 45 inch anchor passenger seats (seat belt ready seats).

ownernote.para: No inspection was required by the customer.

The customer notification letter asked the customer to return the "AUTHORIZATION FOR RECALL SERVICE" card to American Transportation after confirming that they were in possession of this vehicle and checking box #8. We also asked the customer to write in the dealer's name that will be selected to make this repair. This will enable American Transportation to ship the repair kit to you.
We also told them that American Transportation estimates that its dealers will have instructions to remedy this defect by August 15, 2000.

svcproc.title: SERVICE PROCEDURE
svcproc.para: This repair procedure involves adding the specified reinforcement plate under the floor to the mounting hardware for the inboard rear seat rear mounting above the fuel tank. Complete instructions on the repair procedure will be included with the repair kit.

responuscan.para:
Proceed immediately to make necessary correction to units in inventory. All inventory vehicles subject to this recall campaign must be corrected prior to sale, transfer or delivery.
If vehicles have been sold or transferred and you are in receipt of Customer Notification Letters and Authorization for Recall Service cards for those vehicles, transfer location or customer must be notified IMMEDIATELY from your dealer location.

The National Traffic and Motor Vehicle Safety Act, as amended, provides that each vehicle that is subject to a vehicle recall campaign must be adequately repaired within a reasonable time after the owner has tendered it for repair. A failure to adequately repair within 60 days after a tender of a vehicle is prima facie evidence of failure to repair within a reasonable time. If the condition is not adequately repaired within 60 days, the owner may be entitled to replacement with an identical or reasonable equivalent vehicle at no charge, or to a refund of the purchase price less a reasonable allowance for depreciation.

In order to avoid having to replace an owner vehicle or refund the purchase price, every effort must be made to promptly schedule an appointment with each owner to repair his or her vehicle as soon as possible.
